text:
Elizabeth Hurley said her 21-year-old nephew is still in a world of pain, but on the road to recovery just over one week after he was stabbed on a London street.

“The Royals” actress, 52, updated fans on the progress of her sister’s son Miles Hurley in an Instagram post Saturday.

“Thank you to all who sent such kind messages following the news that my nephew @mileshurley1 was viciously stabbed last week,” she wrote. “His wound is shocking, he remains in great pain and he can hardly move, but he is slowly recovering.”

Hurley also praised her older sister, Kate Curran, for her nurturing nature, and vowed to act on making the streets of the British capital safer.

“My sister is an amazing mother and is looking after him and his friend-who was also stabbed,” she wrote. “I have just reached India but am receiving updates throughout the day. We need to make our streets safer and I want to be part of the movement to achieve that. I hope you will join me. More later.”

Miles, a model who has mugged for brands like Dolce & Gabbana, was knifed multiple times on March 8 by an unidentified attacker on a South West London street corner.

He has modeled for brands like Dolce & Gabbana and Roberto Cavalli.

He and a friend, also 21, were discovered with several stab wounds to the back and taken to the hospital.

“They are believed to have been attacked by a group of males who got out of a vehicle and attacked them before fleeing the scene,” authorities told People.

Shortly after news broke, Hurley confirmed the assault, calling it a “brutal attack.”

“The deepest wound just missed severing his spine. By some miracle no vital organs were damaged,” she wrote on Instagram, adding that he lost four pints of blood. “These are sad days.”
title: Elizabeth Hurley gives update after nephew’s stabbing: ‘He remains in great pain’
